product_name: BiodermaHydrabio H2O Micellar Water Face Cleanser for Dehydrated Skin
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganBioderma Hydrabio H2O micellar water face cleanser for dehydrated skin gently removes makeup, impurities and instantly leaves the skin soft and soothed.
details: DetailsBenefitsHydrates and gently cleanses the skin, removing impurities, fine particles, and pollution.Effectively removes makeup from the face and eyes with its unique micellar technology.Instantly soothes the skin, leaving it soft, comfortable, and hydrated.+25% of hydration after 8h (study on 10 volunteers)Ideal for daily use for dehydrated skin.Non-comedogenic.No-rinse formula.Key IngredientsFormulated with Glycerin, Niacinamide and with the Aquagenium™ Complex which targets the skin’s natural moisturizing abilities, and its capacity to retain moistureAlso powered by the natural D.A.F. complex which contributes to enhance your skin’s tolerance, leaving it softer, more comfortable and radiant.Formulated WithoutAlcoholParabensItem 2636041How To UseUse as a daily cleanser and makeup remover to gently cleanse and hydrate the skin. Apply morning and evening with a cotton pad to the face and eyes. No rinsing required.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Glycerin, Peg-6 Caprylic/Capric Glycerides, Disodium Edta, Mannitol, Xylitol, Cetrimonium Bromide, Rhamnose, Niacinamide, Hexyldecanol, Sodium Hydroxide, Pyrus Malus (Apple) Seed Extract, Brassica Campestris (Rapeseed) Sterols,Tocopherol, Fragrance (Parfum).
how_to_use: Use as a daily cleanser and makeup remover to gently cleanse and hydrate the skin. Apply morning and evening with a cotton pad to the face and eyes. No rinsing required.

reviews.headline: Burns eyes
reviews.comments: Do not buy. Tried it for the first time and burns your eye. Doesn't take off eye make-up. Eye is red and swollen. Do not recommend.

reviews.headline: A miserable experience
reviews.comments: I read this was good for sensitive eyes and skin. I don't think I have ever had a worse experience with a MU remover. My eyes immediately burned, and I had bloodshot eyes, which I have never had, even with my very dry eyes. Tread lightly with this.  I am a MU artist and esthetician, so not a woman with no experience in this field.

reviews.headline: Better than the for oily skin version
reviews.comments: My skin is quite oily especially on my t-zone but I can get dehydrated very easily. I like this version because it doesnt feel harsh or drying, which some may think is better for oily skin but drying it can cause more oil production. This product takes makeup off very easily especially if you hold for a few seconds on your eyes for eye makeup removal. I'm also easily acne prone and this hasn't given me any issues. Sometimes I also use it as a quick cleanser in the morning if I feel that my skin is a little sensitive and prefer not to wash with a foaming cleanser.

reviews.headline: So good!!
reviews.comments: I've used Bioderma for years, but never tried the hydrating version. I love it! It quickly removes my makeup without making my skin feel tight or dry. It's definitely more hydrating than the original. Highly recommend this!

reviews.headline: My ride or die
reviews.comments: I've been using Bioderma micellar for so long I remember when they called it crealine water. In my 20s and 30s I used the standard (pink bottle) version. In my 40s I switched over to the blue. I love this product. It is the best eye makeup remover in existence. It's gentle and pleasant and doesn't strip my skin of crucial moisture. I love the subtle tingly feeling it gives. I love how valuable it is for fixing makeup smears etc. Travel friendly too: you can be without water access and still clean your face.

rollup.name: Hydrabio H2O Micellar Water Face Cleanser for Dehydrated Skin
